div.p: W70/6236, unit 466, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to express my best thanks for your goodness of providing for the repayment of the one hundred and fifty pounds, which two years ago I paid out of my slender private means, to effect then at once the transfer of the Dromedaries to the Queensland Government without any accumulating costs.
The camels, originally from the Burke & Wills expedition and owned by the Victorian Government, were in the care of the Royal Park Trustees until disposed of, some to South Australia and 14to M to use in the Ladies' Leichhardt Search Expedition in 1865 (G. Sprigg to J. McCulloch, 6 May 1865,L65/4150, unit 209, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria).Thelatterwere eventually disposed of to the Queensland Government, with M taking the responsibility for their maintenance costs until transfer (M to J. McCulloch, 15 August 1868).
This sum having recently been voted by the Legislative Assembly
Included in the Estimates for 1870, Chief Secretary, Division 25, Miscellaneous item No. 5, as 'Expenses in connexion with the transfer to the Queensland Government of the Dromedaries formerly obtained for Exploration purposes' (Victoria Parliament Parliamentary Paper 1870, no. B 2, p.17), and approved in Parliament on26 May 1870 (Victoria Parliamentary Debates ('Hansard')), vol.10, p. 599.
I beg now to ask, that you will be pleased to issue authority for thepaymentof this sum.
M had last asked for reimbursement in M to J. MacPherson, 13 January 1870, having previously requested it more than once (see M to J. MacPherson, 25 October 1869 (in this edition as 69-10-25a)).ApprovalofM's requestwas minutedon1March 1870;McCulloch approved it again on 18 June and the file was forwarded to the Treasurer.
I have the honor to be,
Ferd. von Mueller C.M.G., M.D., F.R.S.
